bibl.title: Letter from Joseph A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, December 22, 1916

div1.p: LePrince details the past summers' field work in the southern U.S.

div1.head: Letter from Joseph A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, December 22, 1916
div1.p:
We were all very glad to hear
that you were safely back again
and received your notes re
station establishment-.

The summers work has been
fairly satisfactory except for
Baden when the weather was
so unsettled that places were
continually washed out and
we could not get across the
river due to its swollen condition.
However the conditions at Fort
Lawn were quite satisfactory
and the cases there showed
up considerable E. A - Some
of the places at Ft Lawn will
be covered by the lake while
others will not so the field is
a good one for the coming
2
Summer-.

Regarding flight & stained specimens
at Stevens Creek there were recovered
1 A. Q-2800 ft from liberation point
2 A Q- 3245' from " "
1 A Q- 5560' " " "
at, Fort Lawn S. C.

.528-0'=1 mile
2640'=1/2 mile
3 A. Q were recovered at 3090 ft
from liberation station and
they had to fly about 900 ft
over the river as a starter-
only about 300 were liberated
{They were carried over the river-
{had been caught in barns & houses
{on the side to which they returned

At Broad River Griffitts got
some Quad producing places
near the impounded water
and at Talladega Springs
I got the following results
3
8 Miles from Tal SprCoasa R - 1 pond gave Q
5 " " " 4 ponds " Q
3 1/2 " " " 1 " " Q
2 3/4 " " " 1 " " Q
1 " " " 1 " " Q
150 yds " " 1 " " Q
200 ft " " 1 " " Q
100 ft " " 1 " " Q
10 ft " " 1 " " Q

Also in a pool in dried stream
bed I got larvae that hatched
one quad - at Tal Spgr - 1 mile
from Coasa -

The season at Tal. Spgr. was
very dry & anopheles scarce as
compared to previous years -
At the ponds near N Augusta I
got a suprise package - only crucians
& culex-.

Cherokee Pond - 6 miles from Augusta-
on Sand Road ________ 8 Crucians
Mackies Pond - Martintown Road-10 "
C1
B20
4
Butters Pond - _____________________. 2 Crucians
These ponds were examined
Sept 25 - No AQ hatched from Collections
& on same date at Chealhaurs the quad
catch was very small compared to
August-.

At Talladega Springs Ala Power Co
have cleared out Sulphur Spring &
Rock Spring Bite since October
People at Talladega, by house to
house enquiry report 45% had
malaria last Summer-

Mitz main has blood index of school
Probably not yet examined -.

Considering Stevens, Broad River
yadkin, & Cutamla in house catches
we found
(La) of houses examined 58% contained quads
In " " 9% " Puncs
Under houses examined 28% showed Q
" " " 44% " P
Lu Barns Examined 44% " Q
" " " 54% " P-

p.hi: On many occasions AP bit us on porches at night

div1.p:
We had our summers notes typed for
reference next Summer & are busy
now tabulating results & will soon have
data in shape ready for you.

Kindly accept my best wishes for Xmas &
the New Year for yourself & all the Carters-
